post.description:
You can upload up to 500 general ledger accounts in an all-or-nothing fashion. If a general ledger accounts within a batch is malformed or violates a database constraint, the entire batch containing that account will be disregarded.
To have a successful upload, please sanitize the data and ensure the general ledger accounts that you are trying to upload do not already exist on Ramp.
If a general ledger account is already on Ramp but you want to update its attributes, please use the PATCH developer/v1/accounting/accounts/{id} endpoint instead.

field configurations and settings.

post.description:
Upload a file as an attachment to a bill. The file can be uploaded as either
an INVOICE or FILE type. INVOICE type attachments cannot be uploaded if one
already exists on the bill.

This endpoint accepts the [multipart/form-data](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods/POST) format.

Include the file as a part named 'file' with `Content-Disposition: attachment`.
Include the attachment_type as a form field with value 'INVOICE' or 'FILE'.

post.description:
Matrix tables are special-purpose lookup tables where unique combinations
of input values map to result values.

Allows adding result columns to already-created matrix tables
without modifying the input columns. Only result columns
(users and accounting_field_options) can be added.
Input columns cannot be added after table creation.
post.summary: Add a result column to an existing Matrix table

patch.description:
This changes the internal name used in API calls while preserving
the human-readable label. Both input and result columns can be renamed.

post.description:
Returns rows with inputs and results separated.
Inputs are always complete (all input columns), results are sparse (only set values).

Input values define row identity (via external_key).
Result values are mutable and can be partially updated.

post.description:
image and optionally associate it with a transaction.

If a `transaction_id` is provided, the receipt will be linked directly to that transaction. If not, Ramp will attempt to automatically match the receipt to the most relevant transaction based on context.

This endpoint accepts the [multipart/form-data](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods/POST) format.

Include the receipt image as a part with `Content-Disposition: attachment`. Include metadata as parts with `Content-Disposition: form-data`.

post.description:
Expects two headers:
- Authorization header formed from base-64 encoded client credentials as `Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded client_id:client_secret>`
- `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded`

Required content body depends on authorization type method, as defined by `grant_type`.
- Authorization Code Grant (`grant_type=authorization_code`): `grant_type`, `code`, and `redirect_uri` are required. Request must happen after requested scopes have been approved and exchanged for authorization code.
- Refresh Token Grant (`grant_type=refresh_token`): `grant_type` and `refresh_token` are required. User must have previously obtained refresh token in authorization code flow.
- Client Credentials Grant (`grant_type=client_credentials`): `grant_type` and `scope` are required.

Expects an authorization header formed from base-64 encoded client credentials as `Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded client_id:client_secret>`.

Content body must be form-encoded. Example:
```
curl \
    -X POST \
    -H "Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded client_id:client_secret>" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
    --data-urlencode 'token=$RAMP_API_TOKEN' \
    'https://api.ramp.com/developer/v1/token/revoke'
```

Enables same-day delivery for eligible payments. Currently, this functionality is available only for ACH payments.
Same-day delivery may incur an additional fee. For more details, see the [Ramp Help Center](https://support.ramp.com/hc/en-us/articles/4417836454419-Bill-payment-methods-and-timelines#h_01GYSNEJWEJ1G133138FQZTMVK).
To use same-day delivery via the API, your account must first be enabled for this feature. Please contact developer-support@ramp.com to request access before implementing.

Enables same-day delivery for eligible payments. Currently, this functionality is available only for ACH payments.
Same-day delivery may incur an additional fee. For more details, see the [Ramp Help Center](https://support.ramp.com/hc/en-us/articles/4417836454419-Bill-payment-methods-and-timelines#h_01GYSNEJWEJ1G133138FQZTMVK).
To use same-day delivery via the API, your account must first be enabled for this feature. Please contact developer-support@ramp.com to request access before implementing.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the receipt was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the receipt.

receipt_url.description: Pre-signed URL to download receipt image (valid for 1 hour by default).

accounting_date.description: The date for the reimbursement for accounting purposes. If not specified, falls back to the transaction date.

accounting_field_selections.description: List of accounting fields selected to code the reimbursement.

amount.description: The amount that the payor pays.

approved_at.description: Time at which the reimbursement is approved. Presented in ISO8601 format.

attendees.description: List of attendees for the reimbursement.

created_at.description: Time at which the reimbursement is created. Presented in ISO8601 format.

currency.description: The currency that the payor pays with.

direction.description: The direction of the reimbursement. It could be either BUSINESS_TO_USER or USER_TO_BUSINESS.

distance.description: The distance of the reimbursement in miles, for mileage reimbursements.

employee_id.description: Employee ID of the person who made the reimbursement.

end_location.description: Ending location of the trip, for mileage reimbursements.

entity_id.description: Unique identifier of the associated business entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of the reimbursement.

line_items.description: List of line items related to the reimbursement.

merchant.description: The name of the merchant that the reimbursement is associated with.

merchant_id.description: The unique identifier of the merchant. Note that this field may be empty when merchant is populated if Ramp does not recognize the merchant.

original_reimbursement_amount.description: Original reimbursement amount before the currency conversion.

payee_amount.description: Amount and currency received by the payee.

payment_batch_id.description: The unique identifier of the reimbursement payment batch that the reimbursement is associated with.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment batch that the reimbursement is associated with, once paid.

payment_processed_at.description: Time of reimbursement payment. Presented in ISO8601 format.

spend_limit_id.description: Spend limit to which the reimbursement is attributed, if it exists.

start_location.description: Starting location of the trip, for mileage reimbursements.

submitted_at.description: Time when reimbursement was most recently submitted

sync_status.description: Current sync status of the reimbursement.

synced_at.description: Time when reimbursement has been synced. Will be None if the reimbursement is not synced.

trip_id.description: Trip ID associated with the reimbursement if a Trip ID is available.

updated_at.description: Time at which the reimbursement was last updated. Presented in ISO8601 format.

user_email.description: Email of the person who made the reimbursement.

user_full_name.description: Full name of the person who made the reimbursement.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the person who made the reimbursement.

waypoints.description: List of intermediate stops during the trip, for mileage reimbursements.

accounting_date.description: The date for the transaction for accounting purposes, in ISO8601 format. Based on the cleared date, transaction date, or a manually overridden date, depending on your accounting preferences in Ramp.

disputes.description: A list of disputes sorted in descending order by their creation time.

limit_id.description: Unique identifier of the spend limit associated with the transaction

line_items.description: List of line items related to the transaction.

merchant_category_code.description: Merchant category code is a four-digit number in ISP 18245 used to classify a business by the types of goods and services it provides.

merchant_data.description: Purchase data associated related to a transaction provided by the merchant

merchant_descriptor.description: A merchant descriptor is the name that appears on a customer's bank statement when they make a purchase from that merchant.

merchant_location.description: Card acceptor data such as country, city, state, and postal code if available.

minor_unit_conversion_rate.description: The conversion factor to convert from the integer amount to the actual currency value. Divide amount by this value to get the real currency amount. For USD, this is 100 (e.g., 12034 / 100 = 120.34 USD).

original_transaction_amount.description: the original transaction amount before the currency conversion.

policy_violations.description: A list of policy violations sorted in descending order by their creation time.

receipts.description: Receipts listed in ascending order by their creation time, related to the transaction.

settlement_date.description: Time when funds were moved for a transaction, in ISO8601 format.

spend_program_id.description: Unique identifier of the spend program from which this limit was issued.

statement_id.description: Statement ID associated with the transaction if one is available.

synced_at.description: Time when transaction has been synced, in ISO8601 format. Will be None if the transaction is not synced.

trip_id.description: Trip ID associated with the transaction if one is available.

trip_name.description: Trip name associated with the transaction if one is available.

user_transaction_time.description: Time when the transaction was created by the user, in ISO8601 format.

allowed_categories.description: List of [Ramp category codes](/developer-api/v1/overview/conventions#ramp-category-codes) allowed for the limit.

allowed_vendors.description: List of merchants allowed for the limit.

auto_lock_date.description: Date to automatically to lock the limit.

blocked_categories.description: List of [Ramp category codes](/developer-api/v1/overview/conventions#ramp-category-codes) blocked for the limit.

transaction_amount_limit.description: Max amount allowed on a single transaction.

code.description: Authorization code obtained from request to https://app.ramp.com/v1/authorize, to be exchanged for access token. Field is required if grant_type=authorization_code.

grant_type.description: Grant type, must be one of: ['authorization_code', 'client_credentials', 'refresh_token']. Refresh token and client credentials grants must be added to app's permitted Grant Types.

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI previously used in the authorization request, used to verify app. Field is required if grant_type=authorization_code.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token issued to you to get a new access token.

scope.description: Space-separated list of scopes to be granted to the returned token. These must be a subset (including full set) of the app's allowed scopes. Field is required if grant_type=client_credentials.

access_token.description: The access token string. Prefixed with ramp_tok_.

expires_in.description: The duration of which the token is valid, measured in seconds.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token can be used to get a new access token. Note that refresh token won't appear in the response for client_credentials grant type. Prefixed with ramp_tok_.

scope.description: Space-separated list of scopes of the access token.

token_type.description: The type of the token. This should always be 'Bearer'.

token.description: Access token or refresh token to be revoked.

token_type_hint.description: Type of the token to be revoked.

amount.description: Amount of this Vendor Credit that has been applied to the given bill. Currently only USD is supported for Vendor Credits.

amount.description: Amount of the line item, equal to the product of unit quantity and unit price. Currently only USD is supported for Vendor Credits.

unit_quantity.description: Unit quantity of the line item

accounting_date.description: Accounting date of the vendor credit

reference_number.description: Reference number from the vendor credit memo

remaining_amount.description: Remaining amount available to be applied, equal to total_amount minus total_applied_amount. Currently only USD is supported for Vendor Credits.

total_amount.description: Total amount of the vendor credit, sum of all line items. Currently only USD is supported for Vendor Credits.

total_applied_amount.description: Total amount that has been applied to bills and/or draft bills. Currently only USD is supported for Vendor Credits.

vendor_id.description: UUID of the payee associated with this vendor credit
